an8.29:1.1: “‘Now is the time! Now is the time!’ So says an uneducated ordinary person. But they don’t know whether it’s time or not.
an8.29:1.2: Mendicants, there are eight lost opportunities for spiritual practice.
an8.29:1.4: Firstly, a Realized One has arisen in the world—perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those who wish to train, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed. He teaches the Dhamma leading to peace, extinguishment, awakening, as proclaimed by the Holy One.
an8.29:1.5: But a person has been reborn in hell.
an8.29:1.6: This is the first lost opportunity for spiritual practice.
an8.29:2.1: Furthermore, a Realized One has arisen in the world.
an8.29:2.2: But a person has been reborn in the animal realm. This is the second lost opportunity.
an8.29:3.1: Furthermore, a Realized One has arisen in the world.
an8.29:3.2: But a person has been reborn in the ghost realm. This is the third lost opportunity.
an8.29:4.1: Furthermore, a Realized One has arisen in the world.
an8.29:4.2: But a person has been reborn in one of the long-lived orders of gods. This is the fourth lost opportunity.
an8.29:5.1: Furthermore, a Realized One has arisen in the world.
an8.29:5.2: But a person has been reborn in the borderlands, among strange barbarian tribes, where monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen do not go. This is the fifth lost opportunity …
an8.29:6.1: Furthermore, a Realized One has arisen in the world. And a person is reborn in a central country. But they have wrong view and distorted perspective:
an8.29:6.2: ‘There’s no meaning in giving, sacrifice, or offerings. There’s no fruit or result of good and bad deeds. There’s no afterlife. There’s no obligation to mother and father. No beings are reborn spontaneously. And there’s no ascetic or brahmin who is well attained and practiced, and who describes the afterlife after realizing it with their own insight.’ This is the sixth lost opportunity …
an8.29:7.1: Furthermore, a Realized One has arisen in the world.
an8.29:7.2: And a person is reborn in a central country. But they’re witless, dull, stupid, and unable to distinguish what is well said from what is poorly said.
an8.29:7.3: This is the seventh lost opportunity …
an8.29:8.1: Furthermore, a Realized One has not arisen in the world …
an8.29:8.2: So he doesn’t teach the Dhamma leading to peace, extinguishment, awakening, as proclaimed by the Holy One. And a person is reborn in a central country. And they’re wise, bright, clever, and able to distinguish what is well said from what is poorly said.
an8.29:8.3: This is the eighth lost opportunity …
an8.29:9.1: There are these eight lost opportunities for spiritual practice.
an8.29:10.1: Mendicants, there is just one opportunity for spiritual practice.
an8.29:10.3: It’s when a Realized One has arisen in the world, perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those who wish to train, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed.
an8.29:10.4: He teaches the Dhamma leading to peace, extinguishment, awakening, as proclaimed by the Holy One. And a person is reborn in a central country. And they’re wise, bright, clever, and able to distinguish what is well said from what is poorly said.
an8.29:10.5: This is the one opportunity for spiritual practice.
an8.29:11.1: When you’ve gained the human state,
an8.29:11.2: and the true teaching has been so well proclaimed,
an8.29:11.3: if you don’t seize the moment
an8.29:12.1: For many wrong times are spoken of,
an8.29:13.1: If you find yourself in their presence,
an8.29:13.2: so hard to find in the world,
an8.29:13.3: and if you’ve gained a human birth,
an8.29:13.4: and the teaching of the Dhamma;
an8.29:13.5: that’s enough to make an effort,
an8.29:13.6: for a person who loves themselves.
an8.29:14.1: How is the true teaching to be understood
an8.29:14.2: so that the moment doesn’t pass you by?
an8.29:14.3: For if you miss your moment
an8.29:14.4: you’ll grieve when sent to hell.
an8.29:15.3: you’ll regret it for a long time,
an8.29:15.4: like a trader who loses a profit.
an8.29:16.2: a failure in the true teaching,
an8.29:17.1: Those who’ve gained the human state
an8.29:17.2: when the true teaching has been so well proclaimed,
an8.29:17.3: and have completed what the Teacher taught—
an8.29:17.4: or will do so, or are doing so now—
an8.29:18.1: have realized the right time in the world
an8.29:18.3: You should live guarded, ever mindful,
an8.29:19.3: proclaimed by the Realized One, the one with vision,
an8.29:19.4: and taught by the Kinsman of the Sun.
an8.29:20.1: Having cut off all underlying tendencies
an8.29:20.2: that follow those drifting in Māra’s dominion,
an8.29:20.3: they’re the ones in this world who’ve truly crossed over,
an8.29:20.4: having reached the ending of defilements.”
